大学女子バレーボール選手における競技前・後の状態不安について
国際試合におけるバレーボール選手の競技前後の状態不安とパフォーマンスの関係について
paper_title.en: The Relationships between State Anxiety under Pre- and Post-Games and Athletic Performance in Volleyball Players on International Games

description.ja: The purpose of this study was to make clear if there's some relationships between the team performance and the fluctuations of anxiety, measuring the anxiety in normal condition and the state anxiety under pre- and post-games. The goodwill volleyball games held in Shanghai were taken as an object of this study. The test was carried on thirty-eight male players; sixteen players of University J, who joined this tour in Shanghai and had won a championship of the first male university volleyball league before, six start members from Shanghai university (they are the winners of the university volleyball championships in china), ten entry players of senior selected team of Shanghai which trains many national team players, and six start members of junior selected team of Shanghai. We used the shortened version of STAI, in which STAI of Spileberger and his fellows is translated into Japanese and shortened to ten items. For Chinese teams, we used the Chinese version of the same test. The following are the results of this study. 1. The state anxiety after game tend to get lower in comparison with before game when they win it, and that tends to get higher when they lose it. It shows the importance of keeping mental condition of players after game. Besides, this result confirmed the former studies. 2. In normal condition, the state anxiety of Chinese players was higher than that of Japanese players. 3. The state anxiety tend to get higher, the more important a game is considered to the players.
description.en: The purpose of this study was to make clear if there's some relationships between the team performance and the fluctuations of anxiety, measuring the anxiety in normal condition and the state anxiety under pre- and post-games. The goodwill volleyball games held in Shanghai were taken as an object of this study. The test was carried on thirty-eight male players; sixteen players of University J, who joined this tour in Shanghai and had won a championship of the first male university volleyball league before, six start members from Shanghai university (they are the winners of the university volleyball championships in china), ten entry players of senior selected team of Shanghai which trains many national team players, and six start members of junior selected team of Shanghai. We used the shortened version of STAI, in which STAI of Spileberger and his fellows is translated into Japanese and shortened to ten items. For Chinese teams, we used the Chinese version of the same test. The following are the results of this study. 1. The state anxiety after game tend to get lower in comparison with before game when they win it, and that tends to get higher when they lose it. It shows the importance of keeping mental condition of players after game. Besides, this result confirmed the former studies. 2. In normal condition, the state anxiety of Chinese players was higher than that of Japanese players. 3. The state anxiety tend to get higher, the more important a game is considered to the players.

paper_title.en: The relationship between cognitive style of volleyball and soccer players

description.ja: The purpose of this study was to compare and construct the cognitive style of soccer players (contact type game) and volleyball players (net type game), so that we could gather the references and ideas to this study. In this study, 86 soccer players from university (contact type game players), 100 volleyball players from university (net type game players) and total of 186 players had been contrasted. We've measured the cognitive style by applying EFT cognitive style test and compared each group's result. From the test's result, we've come up with these conclusions. The scores of volleyball (net type game) players were meaningfully higher than that of soccer (contact type game) players. From this result, It has been clear that players of net type sports tend to be more field-dipendend that players of contact type sports.
description.en: The purpose of this study was to compare and construct the cognitive style of soccer players (contact type game) and volleyball players (net type game), so that we could gather the references and ideas to this study. In this study, 86 soccer players from university (contact type game players), 100 volleyball players from university (net type game players) and total of 186 players had been contrasted. We've measured the cognitive style by applying EFT cognitive style test and compared each group's result. From the test's result, we've come up with these conclusions. The scores of volleyball (net type game) players were meaningfully higher than that of soccer (contact type game) players. From this result, It has been clear that players of net type sports tend to be more field-dipendend that players of contact type sports.

paper_title.en: The Relationships between State Anxiety under Pre-and Post-Games and Athletic Performance

description.ja: The purpose of this study was to determine the relationships between state anxiety under pre-and post-games and athletic performance. The subjects were 12 regular players of university volleyball team and 20 regular players of unversity soccer team. They were assessed by the Japanese version of the Spielberger's STAI, which was administered 2 weeks (normal condition), 2 hours and just prior to start of each game and just after game set. The results were as follows; 1. State anxiety level tend to be higher 2 hours and just before game than in normal condition: thus comfirming previous studies. 2. It was not possible to determine the relationships between the issue of game and state anxiety under 2 hours and just prior to start of each game. 3. State anxiety level just after game decline at win a game, but ascend at loss a game.
description.en: The purpose of this study was to determine the relationships between state anxiety under pre-and post-games and athletic performance. It was not possible to determine the relationships between the issue of game and state anxiety under 2 hours and just prior to start of each game. 3. State anxiety level just after game decline at win a game, but ascend at loss a game.
